titleStmt.title: In laudem Roberti Greni Cantab. in Artibus Magistri.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: In laudem Roberti Greni Cantab. in Artibus Magistri.

monogr.title: Alcida : Greenes metamorphosis, vvherein is discouered, a pleasant transformation of bodies into sundrie shapes, shewing that as vertues beautifie the mind, so vanities giue greater staines, than the perfection of any quality can rase out: the discourse confirmed with diuers merry and delightfull histories; full of graue principles to content age, and sawsed with pleasant parlees, and witty answeres, to satisfie youth: profitable for both, and not offensiue to any. By R.G
monogr.author: Greene, Robert

div.head: In laudem Roberti Greni Cantab. in Artibus Magistri.

lg.l: OLim praeclaros scripsit Chaucerus ad Anglos,
Aurea metra suis patrio sermone refundens:
Post hunc Gowerus, post hunc sua carmina Lydgate,
Postque alios alij sua metra dedere Britannis.
Multis post annis, coniungens carmina prosis,
Tullius Anglorum nunc viuens Lillius, illum
Consequitur Grenus, prae •… larus vterque Poëta.
